de.fuberlin.wiwiss.ng4j.db.specific
Class DbCompatibility

java.lang.Object
  de.fuberlin.wiwiss.ng4j.db.specific.DbCompatibility
Direct Known Subclasses:
DerbyCompatibility, HSQLCompatibility, MySQLCompatibility, OracleCompatibility, PostgreSQLCompatibility
public abstract class DbCompatibility
extends Object

Superclass for compatibility with different types of databases.

Author:
Jennifer Cormier, Architecture Technology Corporation

Constructor Detail

DbCompatibility

public DbCompatibility(Connection connection)
Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(String tablePrefix,
                       String graphNamesTableName,
                       String quadsTableName)
Initializes the database compatibility mechanism.
This method must be called after instantiating the class, before any methods relying on these variables are called.

Parameters:
tablePrefix -
graphNamesTableName -
quadsTableName -

createTables

public abstract void createTables()
Creates the following 7 required database tables:
* graph
* subject
* predicate
* object
* literal
* lang
* datatype
and the tables named quadsTableName and graphNamesTableName.

The initialize method must be called before this method is called.

getVarcharName

public abstract String getVarcharName()
This is only needed if the DbCompatibility implementation uses URI_DATATYPE, LITERAL_DATATYPE, LANGUAGE_DATATYPE, or DATATYPE_DATATYPE in a method such as createTables().

However a dummy implementation should not return null because the result is used to populate the aforementioned fields even if they are not used.

Returns:
the correct term for a VARCHAR for the database, e.g. "VARCHAR", "varchar", "VARCHAR2"

getDatatype

protected String getDatatype(String varcharName,
                             String length)
For variable-length varchars. Given the term for the varchar and the desired length, returns varcharName(length), e.g. VARCHAR(10).

Parameters:
varcharName - the term for a varchar for the particular database, e.g. "VARCHAR", "varchar", "VARCHAR2"
length - the length of the datatype to create, e.g. 10, 100, 432
Returns:
varcharName with the length appended in parentheses.

getGraphNamesTableNameForQueries

protected String getGraphNamesTableNameForQueries()
Returns the graphNamesTableName to be used for queries.

The initialize method must be called before this method is called.

NOTE: subclasses should override if appropriate. In particular, some databases require that the name be entirely upper case.

Returns:
the graphNamesTableName to be used for queries

tablesExist

public boolean tablesExist()
Checks that table creation has already been done. In order to do so this method checks for the existence of the table named graphNamesTableName.

The initialize method must be called before this method is called.

NOTE: subclasses should override if appropriate.

Returns:
true if table creation has been completed, false otherwise.

getEscapePattern

public Pattern getEscapePattern()
NOTE: subclasses should override if appropriate.

Returns:
a pattern matching special characters that should be replaced in database literals in order to avoid SQL injection.

getEscapeReplacement

public String getEscapeReplacement()
NOTE: subclasses should override if appropriate.

Returns:
the string used to escape special characters in database literals in order to avoid SQL injection.

executeNoErrorHandling

protected void executeNoErrorHandling(String sql)
                               throws SQLException
Executes the given SQL command without error handling.

Parameters:
sql - The SQL command to execute.
Throws:
SQLException

setSchema

public void setSchema(Statement stmt)
               throws SQLException
NOTE: subclasses should override if appropriate.

The default implementation does nothing.

Set the schema, or do any other necessary processing prior to continued execution.

If this method is used for a more general purpose than setting the schema then it can be renamed appropriately.

Parameters:
stmt - The statement being used to execute SQL commands.
Throws:
SQLException

execute

public void execute(String sql)
Executes the given SQL command.

Parameters:
sql - The SQL command to execute.

close

public void close()
Closes the database connection.

getConnection

public Connection getConnection()
Returns:
the database connection

initializePreparedStatements

public void initializePreparedStatements()
                                  throws SQLException
Throws:
SQLException
